bibl.title: Letter from Lillie W. Franck to Philip Showalter Hench, June 20, 1946

div1.p: Franck informs Hench that she has mailed the original interview of Kean by Hench to Kean.

div1.head: Letter from Lillie W. Frank to Philip Showalter Hench, June 20, 1946
div1.opener:
THE ASSOCIATION OF MILITARY SURGEONS OF THE UNITED STATES
PRESIDENT
COL. IRVIN ABELL
MED. REP., U. S. ARMY
BROWN BLDG., LOUISVILLE. KY.
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
ASST. SURG. GEN. WARREN F. DRAPER
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
SECOND VICE-PRESIDENT
BRIG. GEN. EDGAR ERSKINE HUME
U. S. ARMY
THIRD VICE-PRESIDENT
FOURTH VICE-PRESIDENT
CAPT. ROBERT E. DUNCAN
M. C., U. S. NAVY
FIFTH VICE-PRESIDENT
COL. WM. H. TRIPLETT
MG MD KG
SECRETARY
COL. JAMES M. PHALEN
U. S. ARMY, RET.
EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
STUART E. WOMELDORPH, D. C. L.
THE MILITARY SURGEON
EDITOR
COL. JAMES M. PHALEN
U. S. ARMY, RET.
ASS'T EDITOR
CAPT. LOUIS H. RODDIS
M. C., U. S. N.
AIR SERVICE SECTION
PRESIDENT
LT. COL. WILLIAM R. LOVELACE, II
M. C., U. S. ARMY
----
DENTAL SECTION
PRESIDENT
BRIG. GEN. L. C. FAIRBANK
U. S. ARMY, RET.
----
VETERINARY SECTION
PRESIDENT
LT. COL. O. E. MCKIM
V. C., A. U. S.
----
ADMINISTRATIVE SECTION ON
MEDICAL AND ALLIED
PROFESSIONAL SCIENCES
PRESIDENT
LT. COL. W. A. EMOND
P. C., U. S. ARMY
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
June 20, 1946
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This completes the interviews. I have mailed the
original to General Kean, and I trust you will receive all of
them on time.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Lillie W. Franck Next Convention, Hotel Book-Cadillac, Detroit, Mich., October 9-11, 1946, inclusive
GENERAL CHAIRMAN
DR. CARLETON FOX
DAVID WHITNEY BLDG.
DETROIT 28, MICH.
CHAIRMAN, PROGRAM COMMITTEE
DR. WILLIAM D. RYAN
0637 VERNOR HIGHWAY WEST
DETROIT 4, MICH.
CHAIRMAN, HOTELS COMMITTEE
COL. BURT R. SHURLY, MED. RES.
1006 STROH BLDG.
DETROIT 26, MICH.
CHAIRMAN COMMERCIAL EXHIBITS
STEVEN K. HERLITZ
200 MADISON AVENUE
NEW YORK 16, N. Y.
